  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 55 gallon drum of ethanol (un1170) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 9 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023090093
item.description:
Report E-2023090093

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: SCHENECTADY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 8/02/2023 an employee at Veolia's Schenectady, NY 10 day intransit facility was loading drums from a trailer into another trailer when the employee scratched the side of a 55-gallon steel drum with the drum cart while placing it in an outbound trailer. The leak occurred when the employee was moving the drums into the trailer and the employee misjudged the clearance to another drum. The 55 gallon drum containing flammable corrosive liquids was scraped with a drum cart which resulted in causing a leak from the drum. Approximately one pint of liquid leaked out of the impacted drum. Liquid was only observed on trailer right below drum and did not leak out of the vehicle. The drum was overpacked into an 85 gallon salvage drum, the spill cleaned up, and transportation to the ultimate disposal facility was continued. The liquid was cleaned up with spill pads and absorbent material. The duration of release is anticipated to be less than 1 minute as the employee immediately noticed the accident and began taking measures to contain the spill.

item.title: Report X-2023081196
item.description:
Report X-2023081196

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Q.A. was called to the unload to retrieve a damaged wet package from the belly of a trailer. upon further investigation it was realized that it was a hazmat that had bursted open. Q.A. took the leaking hazmat to the cage to be repacked and processed. DescribePack: hazmat had 2 bottles one had a loose cap. one bottle was completely empty soaking the box. closure points were open DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was taken from the unload and put in a tote to be transported to the cage to be evaluated and repacked.

item.title: Report X-2023081079
item.description:
Report X-2023081079

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: WEST HENRIETTA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When unloading a trailer the package came out being crushed and leaking, managers quickly put it in the bin. DescribePack: The package was crushed then it leaked and torn the bottom of box. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Managers put it in the bin and move it away as far away from package handlers as possible.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit due to improper blocking and bracing and that one can of vanilla extract (un1197) that one poly 5 gallon had been crushed by other freight. o.5 gallons had been released. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023080891
item.description:
Report X-2023080891

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: ELMSFORD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and punctured on damage table. All four 1-gallon bottles of Foam-Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner were removed and inspected. All caps were found secured and taped with one bottle with a few less tablespoons of product than the other 3. No punctures or leaks were found at the time of discovery. DescribePack: internal partition corroded and exterior side of package corroded by inner liquid. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: NA
